page.text: United Nations
S
Distr.: General
18 November 2004
Original: English

text.b: Official communiqué of the 5081st (closed) meeting of the
Held in private at the United Nations Office at Nairobi (UNON),
Kenya, on Thursday, 18 November 2004, at 2.30 p.m.

page.text: In accordance with rule 55 of the provisional rules of procedure of the Security
Council, the following communiqué was issued through the Secretary-General in
place of a verbatim record:
"On 18 November 2004, the Security Council held its 5081st meeting in
private.
"His Excellency Mr. Ahmed Aboul-Gheit, Minister for Foreign Affairs of
Egypt, was invited to participate in the discussion in accordance with rule 37
of the Council's provisional rules of procedure.
"His Excellency Mr. Lazarus Sumbeiywo, Special Envoy for the
Intergovernmental Authority on Development (IGAD) on the Sudan, was
invited to participate in the discussion in accordance with rule 39 of the
Council's provisional rules of procedure.
"The Security Council heard statements by their Excellencies Minister
Aboul-Gheit and Mr. Sumbeiywo.
"Members of the Council, the Secretary-General, His Excellency
Mr. Kofi Annan, His Excellency Mr. Ali Othman Taha, First Vice-President of
the Sudan, His Excellency Mr. Aminu B. Wali, Permanent Representative of
Nigeria to the United Nations and representative of the Chairman of the
African Union, and Dr. John Garang De Mabior, Chairman of the Sudan
People's Liberation Movement/Army, had a constructive exchange of views."
